formattedAddress: 22 W 32nd St 7th Floor, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 22 W 32nd St 7th Floor, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: Spacious bar with an industrial-chic vibe, games on TV and private karaoke rooms with VIP packages.

originalText.text: Good K-town karaoke den. There's a main bar to meet up at and hang at afterwards, but the main attraction is individual karaoke rooms that you rent by the hour. Their system takes a little to get used to but works fine. No ability to adjust their sound - only volume up and down. They have bar food that's average - that's not what you come for. There's a buzzer you hit and a waiter will come take drink or food orders. Service is quick - strangely no napkins or paper towels. Also no bathroom toilet paper - maybe their delivery was late. Also strange that there are no coat hooks so on a cold, wet night all of coats seemed to be in the way in the tight, private room for 6 where we had 5.

text.text: Good K-town karaoke den. There's a main bar to meet up at and hang at afterwards, but the main attraction is individual karaoke rooms that you rent by the hour. Their system takes a little to get used to but works fine. No ability to adjust their sound - only volume up and down. They have bar food that's average - that's not what you come for. There's a buzzer you hit and a waiter will come take drink or food orders. Service is quick - strangely no napkins or paper towels. Also no bathroom toilet paper - maybe their delivery was late. Also strange that there are no coat hooks so on a cold, wet night all of coats seemed to be in the way in the tight, private room for 6 where we had 5.

originalText.text: There are plenty of private rooms for parties. For after work gatherings it’s pretty perfect because it doesn’t fill up until much later in the evening. The song book is also pretty solid for English language music. Service was great for the two hours we were there. Our guy was attentive with food and drinks. The rooms are pretty dark though, painted in a dark grey.

text.text: There are plenty of private rooms for parties. For after work gatherings it’s pretty perfect because it doesn’t fill up until much later in the evening. The song book is also pretty solid for English language music. Service was great for the two hours we were there. Our guy was attentive with food and drinks. The rooms are pretty dark though, painted in a dark grey.

originalText.text: Karaoke, akin to what one finds in Asian countries like Korea and Japan. Songs can be chosen from two separate thick books, either by artist or title, and played using corresponding numbers. The song selection was decent but not up-to-date; during our visit in January 2024, it still reflected Spring 2023. Some notable songs from well-known artists were missing. The room temperature was excessively warm and stuffy; we struggled to adjust the air conditioning. A standard tip of 18% was charged, which was quite a bit given that the staff only briefly guided us to our room and explained the system for maybe 30 seconds. Overall, the total price for four people was reasonable.

originalText.text: Awesome karaoke place, my cousins and I had so much fun! Great experience!

text.text: Awesome karaoke place, my cousins and I had so much fun! Great experience!

originalText.text:
Went here for a birthday celebration.. singing was fun but the song choices were outdated.  Once we entered we noticed how the front desk was completely unattended. Didn’t think much of it until we saw a bunch of cards to the side which I found to be extremely risky. Leaving a card with the host was mandatory and seeing how easily they left the cards unattended was off putting... not to mention that the guy at the front was extremely rude to us. There was so much attitude given to us when the rules were not explicitly explained to us. We were put into a room given a paper and then left. We were never let know when our time was up..so have to keep track, it seems like they might have some ploy to keep squeezing money out of you. Gave the guy a 5 dollar tip out of courtesy even tho all he do was enter, be rude and leave. Overall 1/5. I generally believe that the only reason why this place has such a high rating is because of the fun you have with the people you bring not because of the service or place. Would not go back.
Edit: We did not buy food, so we don’t know anything regarding food quality.
